title: Teenage girl 'disappears' for days without telling her dad - so he exacts the perfect revenge
text:

Parents have numerous diabolical ways of doling out some tough love and justice, especially where their teenage kids are concerned. 
Long gone are the days when you'd simply send the offending adolescent to their room, or ground them, or stop their pocket money. 
Now there's the internet, and the infinite possibilities that it offers. 
One cunning dad used this fully to his advantage when his teenage daughter skipped town for an entire weekend without telling her parents. 'Worst dad' 
Taking to Craigslist may seem a little extreme, but then again, if your child disappeared for 48 hours you'd probably be tempted to lock them at the top of a tower until they reached adulthood. 
Instead, "the worst dad in the entirety of the United States of America" decided to sell a 2004 Honda Civic Coupe - his daughter's car. 
"I have been totally unfair in giving my 17-year-old a good running car that gets great mileage," he wrote. 
"It's completely unreasonable for her to pay for the regular maintenance that has been performed on the car since purchase. 
"Totally not okay for her to have a touchscreen stereo with a DVD player, Pandora radio, and Bluetooth capabilities. Read More Parents come up with foolproof way to stop angry teen slamming his door - and have the last laugh 
Car has less than 160 k on it with a lot of life on it. Had the vehicle inspected by a mechanic and had the oil changed after taking it away and parking in my garage since November. 
"Hopefully your child can be home at a reasonable hour and not disappear for the weekend without telling you where they are." It's clearly one nil to dad on this occasion. Like us on Facebook
